website_summaries.verdict: With numerous well-made components and a solid wooden build that's made for little hands, this is a good choice as a first train set for young children.
pros: Set offers over 130 colorful wooden pieces including train components and a track that can be built in four different configurations
cons: Some pieces don't fit together securely, and some of the wheels on the train pieces are wobbly
Not mechanical, but this may not matter to all youngsters

customer_reviews.title: Alternate traditional layout to fix provided layout
customer_reviews.text: I tried setting up the suggested layout (the traditional setup in a rectangular shape), and like other reviewers, I was frustrated that the pieces weren't lining up correctly. Since the pieces fit so loosely together, you can *make* it work, but it isn't right. I spent a good hour and a half and came up with a solution (see photo; only the changes are labeled). I was ready to return the set because I was so frustrated, but with this fix, it works much better, and I'm happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: cdaae13

customer_reviews.title: Buy this but also buy railroad clips to keep together!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect train set! It comes with a bunch of cute pieces like trees, people, roadway signs. I highly recommend buying the railway clips (sure track clips) that keep the pieces that are elevated (bridges) together where they meet. My son is 2 and was able to destroy all of my hard work in seconds but the clips really helped keep everything together once I got them on. We put this on the M&D green and white table and it fits perfectly. The table is a good buy too. Pretty large but perfect for the littles to play on!
customer_reviews.author: rachel grayson

customer_reviews.title: Great toy and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rain set! I love this for my toddler. It is made well and the quality is wonderful. We also have an imaginarium set and it compliments it very well. They adapt beautifully together. It does nohave come with bridges that are self standing but it does have the blocks that fit underneath to support the bridge (not a big deal but my three year old doesn’t understand this concept). The colors are bright and catchy. My son can sit and play with trains for hours. It’s a great toy. I wish it came with some type of storage bin but I found an old Rubbermaid bin that I put everything in.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme D.

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it but I am slightly disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves it but I am slightly disappointed in the quality. The narrow radius turn tracks cause the train engines to bind in the track, the bridges are too low if you want to make a custom track that goes under the bridge, and the instruction for building the pre planned tracks don't line up right. Some of the pieces when connected aren't centered so the tracks don't line up perfectly which causes the trains to derail. We picked the Melissa and Doug brand and not a knock off because we expected the pieces to fit better and unfortunately that was not the case here.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Melissa & Doug quality standards
customer_reviews.text: We’ve owned this set a year and a half and I’m disappointed that the plastic male connectors are coming out of the Y-pieces. The inexpensive generic add-on kits are better made, since they are 1-piece and all-wood. The kids love the set so my husband plans to drill them out and reglue, but this is not the quality we expect from Melissa & Doug.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Bucket top set too!
customer_reviews.text: A great set, although I bought with bucket top kidcraft set to give some variety and they work together. This one doesn't have waterfall or helicopter or airplane like that set. I have a kidcraft ride around train table. This set fills the whole table though which is nice, and the 2 sets integrate together beautifully! The Trains & track are far superior to other sets. Kidcraft sets the tracks are a little loose at the joints causing some trains to snag, so I use only the Melissa & Doug tracks for the Melissa & Doug trains.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Wishart

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces, confirgurationsto big for suggested table
customer_reviews.text: Bought this train set for our grandkids along with the Melissa and Doug Activity table. 2 things you should be aware of. None of the pieces are labeled so setting up the suggested configurations is tricky. Secondly, even though the Activity table is large, none of the suggested configurations fit on it. Needless to say, I was not thrilled about that. Now we will need to try and figure out a configuration that works. I would send all of this back but the kids are excited and want to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: popsicletoes

customer_reviews.title: Nice first set except for couple things
customer_reviews.text: This set seems to be of pretty good quality. You get plenty in this box to set up some fun courses. My daughter actually squealed when she saw it and won't stop playing with it. The reason for the 3 stars is because the vehicles it comes with don't really work great on the tracks. They slip off so easily and it is a bit frustrating. My daughter will push a train through a turn and the whole thing just falls off. The magnets between the train cars are not very strong and they separate rather easily. I'm going to try to buy another brand of train and see if it works any better.
customer_reviews.author: jmcc33

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and quantity
customer_reviews.text: Boy received this for Christmas. They enjoy playing with it however, I notice they knock down the elevated tracks when they are stretching over them. I wish there was a better way to secure them down. I don’t want to glue them. Great quality and quantity! I looked at a lot of sets before getting this one and the matching table too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift For A 2 Year Old Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Always trusted Melissa and Doug and this was no exception. My son is only 2 years old and can't build the elaborate layouts, but he loves pushing the trains down the tracks. As lame as this sounds, the set came with a handful of layouts and putting together the different layouts for him is my fun. Pieces are solid, everything was wrapped well, and the wood is smooth -- no splinters. Added bonus: 2 of the accessories are interactive which my son LOVES. I can't recommend this set enough.
customer_reviews.author: topher

customer_reviews.title: Expand the imagination
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for us. My toddler 2 years old LOVES this set, hes not quite able to build the track according to the pictures but it's a great challenge and goal. He quickly figured out the turning magnet lifts and bridges. He spends hours playing. Way more pieces than anticipated, certainly a pleasing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marie D. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Little one likes it
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale in boscovs for close to the same price maybe a little cheaper. Ordered it on amazon because I didn’t feel like carrying it around the store. Gave it as a Christmas present. He likes it. Made of wood and has magnets like the original did. Much better built than the original is now.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Smoke

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful buy!
customer_reviews.text: I’d buy a ton of these sets if I could. The quality is great, hours of fun, so many possibilities of designs. I’d say ages 2.5 and up. Side note: Don't buy a table for it, children really like to spread it out!! 😂 a table isolates the creativeness of what they can do. I thought about buying a table for it, seriously don’t waste your money on one. It’s a quick and easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Wolverton

customer_reviews.title: trains don't fit on tracks
customer_reviews.text: tracks are OK, but it seems that the trains were designed by a different team who never new the dimensions of the tracks, because the trains don't fit (in the small curve pieces) due to their wheels being too far apart. Once you buy additional trains from a different (compatible) brand, the tracks are usable and lots of fun for our child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cute set
customer_reviews.text: It's a great starter set. My 3.5 year old and 1.5 year old love it. Not too much frill but a lot of fun to play with. The pillar supports aren't very supportive and they keep falling over when my younger child is a little too crazy with his trains so we're going to purchase some better support pillars. Otherwise it's a nice quality set and comes with quite a few different trains. We also purchased some sure tracks in order to keep them together, especially on the bridges - that was an absolute MUST. There's no way the tracks would stay together if you didn't have those connectors
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 year old son. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for him for Christmas and he loves it. It's fun to see him build his track by himself and also with his father and me. You can see his imagination working and he has started using problem solving skills when something doesn't go quite the way he thought it would! Good quality product. Good value. It has enough train pieces so that more than one person can play and the opportunity for creativity is endless. Good job to Melissa and Doug!
customer_reviews.author: Laxgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 2-year-old
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift for our 2-year-old granddaughter. She plays with it endlessly, and it a great toy for building fine muscle control, learning to construct things, and creative thinking. It seems she'll be using it for years to come, since it has so many varying ways to be used.
customer_reviews.author: John Hofland

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys 3&5 love the train set, super sturdy. Mine had a piece that was broken when it arrived looks like it was accidently sawed off but both sodes are there. Showed in pics. But nothing some wood glue couldn't fix. Still love the product and brand and wouldn't choose any over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent train set
customer_reviews.text: We decided to purchase this set after a lot of research, and waffling back and forth between different sets. We couldn't be more pleased. Our boys (4&2) love it, and spend hours playing with it. They are starting to figure out how to put tracks together on their own. As parents, we love that it came with some pre-designed plans. It leaves it open for a defined set-up, but also encourages creativity when setting up a track. The track pieces are excellent quality, the trains roll smoothly, and the extras are a fun addition to set-up (makes for a great task when kids want to be "helpers").
customer_reviews.author: HRWR

customer_reviews.title: Nice set with lots of options to build various tracks
customer_reviews.text: Nice set with lots of options to build various tracks. It even includes instructions for a couple of different setups. My son likes playing with it but the blocks holding up the bridges shift when a 4 yr old pushes his train hard over the them and then the pieces fall apart and collapse. I had also purchased the M&D bridge/tunnel set that doesn't use blocks so it was easy to avoid building the set up and my son didn't mind. I do think the sets that use blocks should include anchors so you can enjoy the set without having to add another $10-20 on top of it to ensure the pieces stay hooked together.
customer_reviews.author: cmaks

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money.
customer_reviews.text: I have always like Melissa and Doug products. They are always well designed and can stand up to a multiple child household. These are the kinds of toys that play well and age well. We often pass them from child to child in the family. This set is entertainment for both an 18 month old, and a seven year old. Often at the SAME TIME! Thumbs up from this momma.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jucha

customer_reviews.title: Consider getting Thomas set
customer_reviews.text: The product in itself is not bad but it is very unstable. As we tried to put it together, we had hard time keeping joint supports from falling. Literally they would fall apart form the smallest touch. Imagine how frustrating it is for a playing child. For now we just set it up without ramps and supports and I will be looking over reviews to see what ideas people have had to fix this. The only thing that is keeping me from returning is that I got a good deal on the price
customer_reviews.author: O. Barr

customer_reviews.title: This is beautiful! Bought 2 for the grandchildren on an excellent ...
customer_reviews.text: This is beautiful! Bought 2 for the grandchildren on an excellent Black Friday sale and was thrilled. It came quickly and was very well packaged. This is a product that will last the kids for many, many years. We have 2 year old twins in the family who can't use the whole set yet, but we just bring out the basics and keep the rest in the box. They love it - excellent quality - excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Born to Shop

customer_reviews.title: Love this train set!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this train set! The quality is amazing and very easy to assemble. I love that there are picture examples of different assembled tracks. I put them in paper protectors and used a binder clip to keep them together for future reference.
customer_reviews.author: TiffaniD

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This set is a lot of fun. It's quite big and just barely fits on our Imaginarium train table. But when put together, the tracks fit very tightly around the train spinner, almost to the point they don't fit. Also the pieces kept falling apart when my son used it, so based on another review we used no residue duct tape to keep the tracks together. It's a great, less expensive option than the snaps.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: grand twins loved this set
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, as Melisa and Doug things usually are. My 2 1/2 year old grand twins loved it. I like that it had 2 trains, one for each boy. They played with it for over 2 hours. My husband had no trouble setting it up on their train table. Boys were even able to help him. Thomas Trains are compatible. Some of their cars also fit on tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen's loves to shop

customer_reviews.title: great toy. My 2 yo and 6 yo grand ...
customer_reviews.text: Trains can not fit under bridges if they are on the track. There is a height problem. Some pieces are a bit splintery. Why not a woman engineer figure? Otherwise, great toy. My 2 yo and 6 yo grand children love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Read the details/fine print.
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than expected so seriously consider your space. Comes apart with bump of table. Well constructed pieces but overall didn’t work for our grandchildren ( and their parents).
customer_reviews.author: Jmpc99

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little train set good quality my only complaint is that the grooves for the wheels are just a tad shallow. While pulling a load the trains always come off the track. Little bit picky but hey it’s something that is annoying if your being creative and pulling a large load!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J M

customer_reviews.title: Great product - compatible with a lot of trains.
customer_reviews.text: great track with recommendations of different designs. the track if built on the stilts given doesn't stay put without Suretrack Clips - highly recommend getting them with this particular track. my kid is obsessed with this track. plays with it morning to night.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Ambrus

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best train set. It’s quite large! There is so much to do, so many different ways to make the tracks. My 3 year old son loves it! We purchased a damaged box and I am so glad we did! Saved us some money and there was nothing wrong with the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Chitty

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved it, but Dad had to keep re-configuring tracks
customer_reviews.text: Its a fun train set with many different build design options...but, if you have kids that are young or kinda rough with toys like mine, every time they run the train over the wood bridge tracks, they would just fall over. I find myself spending more time re-building the bridges than I would like. I wish it was more secure, but it is what it is. When my kids are older, if they mess up the tracks, they can re-build themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Reason for removing a star: the painted pieces in the set are not waterproof - one dip in water and the paint starts peeling off. But overall its a great set. My kid has multiple smaller sets from previous buys / gifts. So superglued this set to an unused table top. (Note: If you go this route, please air it enough before letting your kids anywhere near the tracks. Super glue has a warning that explicitly states that that the ingredient is a known carcinogen.) Guess did not do a great job of gluing all pieces properly, so whenever a piece (track/pillar) comes off my 4 year old gets Elmer's craft glue from his stationery and fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: Lekhak

customer_reviews.title: it is hands down his favorite toy. He has a few wooden Thomas trains ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son is obsessed with trains so we got him this kit for his 2nd birthday. He loves it! We had to leave the track flat though, when we built hills or bridges he could never play with it without it all falling apart. He plays with it every single day, it is hands down his favorite toy. He has a few wooden Thomas trains that fit perfectly on this track as well. It fits perfectly on the Melissa and Doug train table. Perfect for a little train lover.
customer_reviews.author: JAG10

customer_reviews.title: this is a great wooden train set
customer_reviews.text: So if you are on a budget, this is a great wooden train set. We bought it, and when we can afford it we accessorize it with Thomas the train buildings. The train pieces are well made, and we haven't had any issues with the product itself. The trains are cheaper... go ahead and buy yourself some chuggington, bio, or thomas trains. Your little one will thank you...... and be forewarned that the set does lack detail that the other more expensive sets have. We paid 65... I would say this set isn't worth buying if it is more than 80.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Fun set!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson already had some wooden tracks from a garage sale, but needed more interesting features, like the turntable and bridges, etc. This kit was a real hit! The only small complaint is that the blocks to raise the tracks up to the bridges do not lock in place at all, so we have many “bridge collapses”.
customer_reviews.author: PatRose

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal. My only complaint is that my two-year ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good deal. My only complaint is that my two-year old is not delicate enough with his playing to not knock over the hills with the blocks that are supposed to support them. I have a feeling he might be board with the train set by the time he has that self control.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Dudek

customer_reviews.title: Most kids enjoy playing with trains, so a good set goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son when he turned 4. He's about to turn 6 and it still gets a lot of use. I don't think anything has broken, but some of the boxcar tops separated from their chassis. A little glue and a clamp, though, and they're back in business. Whenver other kids visit our house, this is still one of the most-played-with toys. And, our 2-y.o. son is just getting started playing with them. We picked up a train table on the cheap just before we bought this, and the table has helped make the train set a prominent (and largely permanent) toy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Surasky

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Train Set!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 2 year old grandson and he LOVES this train set. It's always thrilling to give a gift and see them actually play with it! He loves trains and this set gives him so much joy. I can see his imagination taking over when he's playing with his trains. Even his parents enjoy this!! The Melissa & Doug train table is a must...puts this at just the right height for the wee ones to stand and enjoy. Don't hesitate to purchase...it's a quality product and the possibilities are endless. Hours and hours of creative fun for children.
customer_reviews.author: Breezer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great toy for toddlers! And I'm so impressed with the quality and size -- it's a lot of items for the price. My son especially loves the magnetic feature on the cranes. Great train set! And a great way for parents to join in play!
customer_reviews.author: what it is

customer_reviews.title: So many options
customer_reviews.text: My son was obsessed with a similar breo train set in out local store, but we couldn't afford it. We found this on Amazon and it was much cheaper with more stuff!!!! My son loves it!! But it is very big takes up a lot of storage space!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marla Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Well-made product
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 2 1/2 year old grandson who lives in a different state so I don't get to see him play with it, but I did see the product and watch him (and his older cousins) play with it a bit at Christmas, and it seemed to be a substantial, well-made product inviting creative play. My grandson's parents are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Well made and tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson, now 4 yrs old loves this train set and plays with it constantly since Christmas. Very creative and entertaining toy that his dad and grandpa like to help play with too and build all kinds of track variations. Highly recommend. Well made and tons of fun.
customer_reviews.author: JetBay

customer_reviews.title: Very good value and a lot of fun - good quality but not excellent
customer_reviews.text: My son has had no end of fun with this set. It is large enough for making interesting layouts. The quality is good but there are a few places where it could be better. On the set I got, the roof on one of the cars does not sit all the way down. And the suspension bridge has some of the plastic reaching down where the wooden track was not mounted exactly right such that not all of the cars (the engines in particular) will go underneath. They catch a little bit. So I would buy it again but the quality of assembly could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon M. Harty

customer_reviews.title: Great product, for kids above 5
customer_reviews.text: Reccomend for older children, comes apart to easily for toddlers
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C Botta

customer_reviews.title: Santa did well with this set!
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought this for my little guy and he has played with this set EVERYDAY since (it end of Jan now). The set comes with many different options if configurations and little add on’s (trains, trees, signs, etc). All pieces are wood and painted with nice thick colors. Quality set for a young one.
customer_reviews.author: RetailTherapy

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Niece
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and loved by the recipient! Comes with a lot of stuff that can easily be reconfigured.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: A winner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well done set! 100 plus "useful" pieces (not too much scenery and tree things thank you) , good route plans, sturdy construction, lots of options, Compatible with other wooden railways. All good! Perhaps a few track joiners for those "one correct track to few" layouts would have been perfect. I haven't found a perfect non permanent solution to the level raiser blocks which can fall with the play I've seen, (Perhaps Velcro or double side sticky tape?). Otherwise An absolute winner for my children and I.
customer_reviews.author: Lester A. Goodwine

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: We debated and researched to ridiculous lengths before purchasing this particular set. Our little boy has loved it so we're happy with our decision to save $$$ by not buying the official Thomas set instead. My only complaint (and I don't know if this would be different with other brands), but the tracks elevated portion of the tracks and bridges come apart annoyingly easily. We finally got one box of SureTrack clips and will need another box to finish the job. Maybe purchase both together to save the headache. Otherwise, it really is a good set- and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bay Area

customer_reviews.title: Love this train set
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality of this train set. I will be buying the. Other set to extend the rails.
customer_reviews.author: Emoni7

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay together very well
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the train set;however, the pieces will not stay together. He is three and has a hard time putting it back together. He also doesn't have the light touch and finesse of an older child so it is extremely hard to keep together. My husband finally took all the bridges out of it to help it stay in one piece so he can drive his train around. I was also disappointed in the strength of the magnets that hold the train and train cars together. The train cars come apart from the train when my son is driving the train. I would not recommend this train set. I am a little bummed we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: KerriC

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SETUP!
customer_reviews.text: My younger children are very engrossed in the variety of configurations this set can produce. They tore it down and reset it up in lots of fun and challenging ways. It was wonderful watching them spend time playing together to built a creative train station. This set is very functional with plenty of variety for children 4-9 years of age.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Some aspects of this product are great, while others are very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Some aspects of this product are great, while others are very disappointing. My girls love the trains, the pieces are cut without rough edges and fit together well. The biggest issue is the little pieces that hold up the tracks, which are unstable and easily knocked over. Before my girls even got to go around the tracks once, we had to rebuild the raised areas multiple times. Once my husband put the track together so that everything was ground-level and there were gaps in the middle for our girls to sit in while they played, this set was a huge hit!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea W

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but..
customer_reviews.text: My son loves trains and this is a good quality product. HOWEVER, they should have made it more stable. Every time he plays the tracks come apart and the upper railways fall down. You need to rebuild it every time or just glue the all thing together.
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: The painted pieces seem to be made of softer wood and dents easily but otherwise good affordable train set for kids
customer_reviews.text: I custom made a train table topper with this set. I cut and made some different lengths of track too. The painted pieces seem to be made of softer wood and dents easily but otherwise good affordable train set for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Super Saver

customer_reviews.title: It is like building a train set on dominoes....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. he is 3. the trains do not glide well. if you bump the table, the tracks fall down. it was frustrating for him and for me. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Nardini Tamarin

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I did not know what I was getting into when I made this purchase sight unseen. I was so impressed when the package arrived and I was able to put it together Christmas Eve night in less than one hour. My soon to be 2 yr old and 3 1/2 yr old boys loved it!!!! They have not stopped playing with the set. I would strongly urge anyone that is going to buy this set-- to go ahead and get the train table. You will need an elevated, flat surface for it to sit on. The pieces are well made and I am still shocked for what you get for less than 100.00 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good product.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to construct usable train track configurations. However, I believe I purchased them too early as my grand children didn’t appear interested in them. The grand children are all between 16 and 20 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good set of tracks
customer_reviews.text: Great train tracks, but they do fall easy with an energetic lil boy :) Be ready to keep fixing the tracks until your child learns to do it themselves, and that will be about every 5-10 minutes, lol. With that said it is a great quality set of tracks for the trains that come with it as well as the Thomas and Friends wooden railway trains :) You little one will enjoy :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: loads of creative fun!
customer_reviews.text: "santa" got this for my 3 yr old for christmas this year since he saw how much she enjoyed playing with the train sets at friends homes and at the YMCA. we play with it literally every day. it's a huge set so there are tons of fun, new, creative ways to build and it provides hours of fun. some of the pieces are loose in the connection area-- if you want it to be super secure, buy the connector stablizer things. it hasn't been an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Lots of pieces. Raised tracks bump apart easy and my 3 year old has too much fun destroying set ups... So maybe it will get more use when he has more fun designing and building track set ups himself. But, still pleased with the item. * after 6 months nothing is broken! some paint has rubbed/chipped off corners of most used toy (tanker truck). * it was significantly less than $100 when we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: LMack

customer_reviews.title: Choo-Choo
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson. I have never been disappointed in Melissa and Doug products. He is almost 4 and had great fun putting the train track together his way. This toy should provide entertainment for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how extensive this set was. Comes with tons of tracks, buildings and a handful of trains. So many kids things are so overpriced, i was pleased of this value. I originally wanted to buy the Thomas brand roundhourse, crane and buildings, but then i realized that my kids could care less about the brand. We do however get the Thomas trains, the melissa and doug ones are okay and supplement our thomas ones. These are a nice wood and well made. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal high quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set very complete and a lot of fun. Best wooden train set I’ve bought and this is the 4th one. Stick with Melissa and Doug for quality wooden toys
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: This wooden train layout provided my grandson an his dad with hours of fun. However, I recommend the track supports, for layout stability
customer_reviews.author: dennis sabourin

customer_reviews.title: perfect train set! Glad we got this over the more expensive brands!
customer_reviews.text: great train set. We added a masonite board to our activity table and then used a hot glue gun to glue the pieces down. This has worked great and our 2 year old son loves the set. And this way, if he doesnt want to play with it, we can just remove the masonite board and he has the activity table to be used for other purposes
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Tracks fall away easily
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous set. I really dislike Thomas so this was perfect for us. Issue is it falls apart SO easily. Ended up having to hot glue some of the pieces so they would stay together while my 3 year old plays. I would recommend hot glue so if you wanted to change the configuration you'd still be able to get it apart.
customer_reviews.author: RevRain

customer_reviews.title: Gets kids away from electronics and use their imaginations!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves trains! He enjoys build the different railroads, tunnels, ramps, etc. Easy clean up—it actually fits back into the original box!
customer_reviews.author: Merrilee Willer

customer_reviews.title: Get clips
customer_reviews.text: Love this train set but I am very glad I followed the advice of other reviewers and got the clips to hold the tracks together when they're elevated. They are very temperamental and fall at the slights movement
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, good quality, bring colors.
customer_reviews.text: My son is very happy with it. Fits with other brand wooden tracks, even Ikea, and matches nicely with a wooden garage by Melissa & Doug he got from somebody over Christmas. The paint started chipping a bit from the little train parking part, but he has not been very gentle with it either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better screw them down?
customer_reviews.text: So it goes together just fine and fit on the table I got, but everything falls over when the kids try to run their trains over it!
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Over a year and still looks brand new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2yr old for Christmas 2016. A year has passed and it remains one of his favorite toys. He loves putting the tracks together in different configurations. He ask me to help and I admit I think I have just as much fun making new designs. It is very durable and looks brand new. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BETH

customer_reviews.title: Have wanted a set like this since I was a kid
customer_reviews.text: Have wanted a set like this since I was a kid. Now I get to play with my four year old granddaughter. A table would enable the pieces to stay in place better, but setting up on the floor allows for more imaginative layouts. However, they are easily kicked out of place by an active four year old and a 64 year old with size14 feet. The magnetic couplers on the train cars could be stronger as long trains come apart when pulled up grades or around curves.
customer_reviews.author: harhornet

customer_reviews.title: The three year old I bought this for was delighted by her new "choo choo twain" and her dad ...
customer_reviews.text: The three year old I bought this for was delighted by her new "choo choo twain" and her dad had a blast helping her set it up. This is a quality made set with well crafted sturdy pieces that should withstand years of play. The box contains several suggested layouts but there's lots of room left for creativity - the set is HUGE and you and your child can craft hundreds of different configurations. While an older child (or adult) might appreciate an electric train set, this wooden classic is powered by imagination and young children will enjoy moving the train around the tracks. I do recommend the track stays, as rough play can cause the tracks to slide apart.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Barta

customer_reviews.title: High value. Good quaity.  Basic features.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2-year old daughter who gravitates to every train table she finds in every toy store we visit. The tracks are excellent. The trains are nice. The features are pretty basic. The two cranes included are both a bit cheapy and not easy to use. The suggested set-up plans don't actually work, so you might take them with a grain of salt. This is a great vale as a starter set. I recommend buying this as your starter set, if only for the track alone! Your child will love it right out of the box and you can add on as you wish with more interesting Thomas items.
customer_reviews.author: Architecture Lover

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Low quality and waste of money! The pieces fit loosely and unles the child is a careful teenager they will be very sad when The whole thing collapses when playing. We feeelntwrrible for our daughter who waited months for her first train set to be so disapointed when it was all over the floor minutes after assembly
customer_reviews.author: DanJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice overall. The magnets in the trains aren't as ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice overall. The magnets in the trains aren't as strong as other brands. Also, the track doesn't fit perfectly. A lot of the connections don't fit well even when following the given layout exactly. A lot of the track pieces are under pressure and have to be forced into place.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: and he loved it! The set comes with a few train ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for Christmas, and he loved it! The set comes with a few train set up ideas. We use this train with the Melissa and Doug activity table. I recommend buying train clips for young children. I bought 2 boxes of train track clips, and I should have bought 3.
customer_reviews.author: Noahsmom

customer_reviews.title: All wood construction - Great value
customer_reviews.text: Well put together with interchangeable parts with the Thomas and Friends playsets. This creates pretty large tracks. Sureclips are suggested as when you begin going to the second level with supports the added sureclips give it an extra strength preventing it falling apart and frustrating little engineers. If you want the whole track to be secure in the largest design you'll need two boxes of sureclips.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Wow !
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it. They've constructed railway system between their rooms. There "go to". Play with it for hours
customer_reviews.author: Joyce K

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set I purchased for my 3 year old grandson ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set I purchased for my 3 year old grandson for his birthday. Also got the table to go with it so he can keep it set up in his room. Would recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Zan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Thomas and Brio
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves Thomas, as does my six year old. Track is always at a premium, so we bought this set. It surpassed all expectations. It is flexible, and gives our sons enough room to imagine all sorts of adventures. This is an amazing value, and I am typically quite critical and thrifty. Why pay more? Note that a lot of the track is elevated, which our son loves, but it is easy to knock over and frustrating for our younger one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Triumph

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea. Wouldn't recommend for ages 4-5 though.
customer_reviews.text: The idea of the toy and the material everything is made from is great. That being said this toy is Very unstable when set up. It's easy for the elevated pieces to fall over. Not recommended for a child around the ages of 4-5.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshisant

customer_reviews.title: My nephews play with this constantly.
customer_reviews.text: My nephews play with this constantly. The only negative is the supports for the raised track sections aren't very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gift for our 2 year old son. This set is an amazing value for the price. The pieces fit well and the quality is good. The set includes plenty of pieces and extras. My son loves the crane that lifts cargo with a magnet. For younger kids - the raised design of the bridges is not that stable. We only build flat tracks at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 2.5 years old, and she has been totally obsessed with this set since we received it as a gift about 2 weeks ago. The design is very good - there are some very nice trains and parts in there. I will try to update as time goes by - but it looks to be a very good quality train track. No chemical smell to the wood, either. Very happy with this set!
customer_reviews.author: JDTx

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves this train set! We have purchased a ton of Melissa and Doug items for our toddler, all of which seem to be high quality and long-lasting. My only complaint with the train set is we are unable to use one of the trains as the magnets on it seem to be too weak to even pull one car. The same train also has a wheel that has never functioned properly. However, for the price we paid for the set we got more than we expected. Kudos to Melissa & Doug!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea R

customer_reviews.title: Great train set!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, quality train set for a good price. Many other brands are much more expensive with fewer pieces. This set comes with everything you need to have hours of fun playing trains! My 2 year old son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Customeyez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Loads of pieces and trains etc. 3 and 5 year old sons love the set. The only that doesn't work too well are the raise supporting blocks. One little knock and they all fall over. "Daddy, please fix... ." Stick to building only flat tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great train set!
customer_reviews.text: The train set is very well made and is a great value for the money. Our grandson loves playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey E. Shirey

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set!
customer_reviews.text: So far, we're very happy with this set. While it's not cheap, it's a great value, as the pieces are heavily track-oriented, rather than accessory-oriented. Like most sets of this type, the bridge supports tend to wobble alot during play, but that's not to take away from the overall play value. It's of course totally compatible with our growing collection of Thomas train engines, so it's definitely a hit!
customer_reviews.author: KSA

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Train Set
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this train set over all. LOTS of pieces to put together... Yet it can be put to great use if you only used a quarter of the pieces, too! I recommend setting it up in a hard surface of some sort... Will definitely prevent the bridges and things from falling over. Quality product and would recommend to friends without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a nice train set and is built with a decent quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sons 2 year old birthday and though at first it was challenging for him to play with it without destroying the setup is was usefull in teaching him a new lever of being tactful. Overall it's a nice train set and is built with a decent quality considering it's around 80.00 bucks. I know we will enjoy it for time to come.
customer_reviews.author: The Curious Catapult

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: This train set is wonderful. My 3 year old loves it, and I enjoy playing with it with him. I definitely recommend (as others have) that you purchase at least two sets of Suretrack. It is so much easier to keep the raised parts together with these clips. The only reason I gave it only four stars for durability is because we did have one piece break: one part of the T-junction female connection broke off. BUT, I am sure we could get it replaced. And, I don't think it would happen on any other piece. Overall, this set is 100% worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Caron

customer_reviews.title: Great train set.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and granddaughter are super train fans and this is their wonderland that they get to create together. Love this train set. Durable, fun, wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Glue It Down for best use
customer_reviews.text: I love this train set, but wished it actually fit the "OTHER" trains. The tracks are wide and only work with the Melissa and Doug wooden trains. Super cute and durable. I glued all of the tracks together and down to the train table though because I was tired of my 2 year old destroying it every 2 seconds. Now he can play all day long and it won't fall apart on him! GLUE IT DOWN!
customer_reviews.author: O. Straw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a train set for your kids, this is the one to buy! You can't beat the price for such great quality. My boys, age 3 and 18 months, LOVE this set. My 3 year old loves to set up the tracks in different patterns. My 18 month old likes to take the track apart, he's a little too young for this set, but he'll grow into it. We considered screwing or gluing the track down, but after seeing my 3 year old have so much fun creating different track patterns, we decided to leave it free.
customer_reviews.author: auntrhody

customer_reviews.title: Bridges need additional connection strength
customer_reviews.text: Ramps and bridges are not stable or robust enough for child play as provided. Had to use a combination of third-party connectors and duct tape to make it last beyond a single train run.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Great Train Set!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our, almost 3 years old, son and it really is a great train set. It is a great price and seems like great quality as well. Setting up a track was the hardest part. We bought 3 packs of Sure Track but only used 2 pack. We only used them on the elavated sections to keep it secure. We also bought the Mountain Tunnel(not M&D, but sold on Amazon)to add to it. It really looks nice and our sons loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Betsey

customer_reviews.title: Train fun!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson ad he really loves it. Great for building and rebuilding. Always in use.
customer_reviews.author: mmknow

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Wooden Railway Set
product_meta.description:
This amazing wooden railway set includes everything needed for budding train enthusiasts: a spacious roundhouse engine shed, dozens of curved and straight track pieces, trees, workers, and traffic signs; multi-piece trains; magnetic-tipped cranes; switches and a T-junction for changing course; and a suspension bridge, trestle bridge, and roundtable, too! With more than 132 pieces, this set offers tremendous value! Mix and match with other train sets—it’s compatible with all popular wooden railway systems. Our Wooden Railway Set includes a 6-piece freight train with cargo, a 4-piece passenger train, and a 3-piece flatbed truck with cargo. Kids can create up to 4 track configurations, enjoying hours of screen-free play. The Wooden Railway set makes a great gift for kids ages 3 years and up. This train tracks playset measures 17” H x 5” W x 28” L and weighs 17.1 pounds. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

AMAZON.COM
Melissa & Doug

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: ALL ABOARD FOR TRAIN PLAY: This railway playset includes everything needed for budding train enthusiasts. Our Wooden Railway Set includes a 6-piece freight train with cargo, a 4-piece passenger train, and a 3-piece flatbed truck with cargo.
HIGH-QUALITY KIDS TRAIN SET: The Melissa & Doug Wooden Railway Set is a train set for children 3 and up. It’s made from high-quality materials and is compatible with other wooden railway systems.

EASY TO ASSEMBLE: Our wooden train set for children includes 100 wooden track sections and supports, along with over 30 train accessories for kids. It includes easy-to-follow instructions for four different track configurations.

GIFT FOR AGES 3 AND UP: This set makes a great gift for kids ages 3 years old and up, inspiring hours of hands-on, screen-free play. The Melissa & Doug Multi-Activity Train Table is a great add-on to give kids a dedicated space for imaginative play.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News calls “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest-quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!
